docs.lead_paragraph: 8:30 P.M. (Nickelodeon) THE UNTOUCHABLE KIDS OF INDIA In the world's largest democracy, the caste system still oppresses a group of more than 150 million people -- the Dalits, or untouchables, considered so far below the rest of the population as to be subhuman, to the point that traditionally their shadows were not allowed to fall on members of the upper castes. Although it has been illegal in India to practice inequality and segregation since 1950, discrimination in living conditions, employment and education still occurs. In this ''Nick News'' special, Linda Ellerbee, above, travels to India to interview Dalit children who are fighting for their rights. ''Can they change their world?'' she asks. ''As Gandhi said, 'You may never know what result may come from your action, but if you do nothing, there will be no result.' '' 8 P.M. (ABC Family) NATURE OF THE BEAST Rich (Eddie Kaye Thomas) is the perfect groom, except for his annoying habit of turning into a werewolf. But Julia (Autumn Reeser) won't let that stand in the way of her dream wedding. Eric Mabius (''Ugly Betty'') also stars.

docs.lead_paragraph: " Every once in a while, I’m asked, as others are, you know, what would you do in your first 100 days as president? What are the circumstances going to be over a year from now? You know, with the changing world we live in and all, you know, it’s pure speculation as to the nature of the confrontation, the challenges, both from a security standpoint and from an economic standpoint.

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation’s schools have made “considerable improvements” in nutrition, fitness and health over the last six years, according to a new government survey.

headline.main: Schools Found Improving on Nutrition and Fitness
headline.sub: More Salads and Recess, Fewer French Fries ;

docs.lead_paragraph: Like many parents, I was fairly shocked to read in The Times that a Maine school district will begin dispensing birth control to middle-school students. It's difficult to imagine that the 11- to 13-year-olds I've met could possibly be interested in sex.
docs.abstract: Is contraception really necessary in middle school?
docs.snippet: Is contraception really necessary in middle school?

docs.lead_paragraph: For entirely different reasons, these were the two most original and intriguing shows of the year. Neither one is an innovation exactly, but both are ingenious riffs on a classic genre.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some American readers, and I am one of them, knew of Anne Enright, the winner of this year's Man Booker Prize, through her essays long before they'd read her fiction.
docs.abstract: Anne Enright in London after winning the Man Booker prize. (Photo: The Associated Press) Some American readers, and I am one of them, knew of Anne Enright, the winner of this year's Man Booker Prize, through her essays long before they'd read her fiction. Enright's first-person pieces appeared frequently in the London Review of Books, [...]
